ProgramName: Master of Science in Aeronautics
EnglishScore: All international applicants whose primary language is not English must submit an official score from the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), International English Language Testing System (IELTS), or Duolingo.
Concentration: ['Aviation/Aerospace Education Technology', 'Aviation/Aerospace Management', 'Aviation Safety Management Systems', 'Air Traffic Management', 'Space Studies', 'Unmanned Aircraft Systems', 'Aviation/Aerospace Operations']
Description:
The Master of Science in Aeronautics (MSA) is Embry-Riddle's flagship graduate program, offering a technical, professional-oriented, and broad-based aviation/aerospace education. The MSA degree is for students who want to advance their current knowledge and experience in the aviation/aerospace industry, as well as for those who are seeking to transition into the field.

The Master of Science in Aeronautics degree program builds on Embry-Riddle’s strong aviation foundation, providing students with a deep understanding of aviation and aerospace operations, safety, security, and regulations. It is a professionally oriented program designed to meet the demands of the modern aerospace industry.

Students will gain a broad perspective on all facets of aeronautics, including air transportation, aircraft systems, human factors, maintenance management, aviation safety, and more.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Aeronautics with Specialization in Aviation and Aerospace Sustainability
EnglishScore: In addition, applicants for whom English is not the primary language must attain a minimum score on the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) or International English Language Testing System (IELTS-Academic). A minimum score of 550 (paper-based) or 79 (Internet-based) on the TOEFL is required. The IELTS-Academic test is also accepted with a minimum score of 6.0. Completion of an ELS Language Center's program (level 112) with a grade of B or better is also accepted.
Requirements: For admission to this program, applicants are required to have a bachelor’s degree with a minimum GPA of 2.5 from an accredited degree-granting institution. Applicants who already possess a master’s degree need only to have a bachelor’s degree from an accredited degree-granting institution.
Department: College of Aviation / College of Aeronautics
Description:
The Master of Science in Aeronautics (MSA) degree is a broad, yet deep program designed to provide aviation and aerospace professionals with a keen understanding of aviation and aerospace operations, safety, security, systems, quality and management. Offered by the College of Aeronautics, the MSA is a completely online degree that allows students the flexibility to work on their studies anytime, anywhere in the world.

The curriculum provides a strong, technical foundation for those looking to advance their career. Graduates are prepared for leadership and management roles in all segments of aviation and aerospace, including airlines, airports, corporate aviation, government, and the U.S. military. The MSA has been a flagship, online program for Embry-Riddle since 1993 and is the academic pillar of our Worldwide Campus.
Accredidation: The Master of Science in Aeronautics is accredited by the Aviation Accreditation Board International (AABI).

ProgramName: Master of Science in Aeronautics with Specialization in Small Uncrewed Aircraft Systems (sUAS) Operations
Term: Rolling admissions for Fall, Spring, and Summer terms
EnglishScore: Applicants from countries where English is not the primary language must demonstrate English proficiency by taking one of the following exams: TOEFL (Test of English as a Foreign Language), IELTS (International English Language Testing System), Cambridge English Language Assessment, Duolingo. Successful completion of an approved ESL program (ex. ELS Level 112) may also be accepted in lieu of test scores.
Description:
The Master of Science in Aeronautics (MSA) degree gives students a technical look into the aviation and aerospace industry. Students gain the specific knowledge and skills needed to elevate their careers, whether that’s in flight, maintenance, safety, education or another related field.

This graduate program is designed for aviation professionals looking to advance their knowledge and for students who have a bachelor’s degree but wish to transition into the aviation industry. Graduates of the M.S. in Aeronautics program are set up for a competitive advantage to advance their careers.

Within the Small Unmanned Aircraft Systems (sUAS) Operation specialization, students will learn about topics critical to the sUAS operation industry including sUAS design, control and navigation, applications, data collection and processing as well as safety and human factors.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Aeronautics with Specialization in Uncrewed and Autonomous Systems
EnglishScore: Applicants for whom English is not their primary language must either: Attain a minimum score on the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) of 550 (PBT) or 79 (IBT). OR Attain a minimum score on the International English Language Testing System (IELTS) of 6.0. OR Attain a minimum score on the Duolingo English Test of 105. OR Successfully complete an English Language Course (ELS) with a score of 112. OR Earn a baccalaureate or graduate degree from a college or university where English is the primary language of instruction.
Requirements: Applicants for the Master of Science in Aeronautics (MSA) program must have a baccalaureate degree from an accredited degree-granting institution with a cumulative grade point average (CGPA) of 2.5 or higher on a 4.0 scale. Those who possess a baccalaureate degree with a CGPA less than 2.5 may be considered for conditional admission. Applicants should submit the following: 1. A completed graduate application for admission; 2. Official transcripts from all previously attended colleges and universities. Transcripts from any international institutions must be evaluated through a NACES approved agency, such as World Education Services, Inc. or an equivalent agency; 3. A resume outlining work experience. 4. Three letters of recommendation (forms provided). 5. A statement of purpose detailing why the student wants to pursue the MSA, and how this will help them achieve their professional goals.
Description: The Master of Science in Aeronautics (MSA) is a multi-disciplinary program that combines a core of aviation and aerospace courses with a choice of specialization options, enabling you to tailor a degree program that elevates your career. The MSA program is an online program that offers both convenience and quality and has been ranked as one of the best online graduate programs for the past seven years by U.S. News & World Report. Build on your aviation/aerospace foundation as you work toward a career in management with a degree that strategically positions you for growth. The program is ideal for professionals already in an aviation/aerospace career and for those who wish to enter the field. As an MSA graduate, you will have the skills necessary to succeed as a leader in today’s demanding aviation/aerospace industry. The Uncrewed and Autonomous Systems specialization focuses on the operational and safety aspects of uncrewed and autonomous systems, including design, development, policy, and procedures. Explore topics related to uncrewed and autonomous systems, such as command and control, human factors, data links, and payloads.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Aeronautics with Specialization in Space Operations
EnglishScore: If English is not your primary language, you must either: Attain a minimum score on the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), the International English Language Testing System (IELTS) or the Duolingo English Test (DET); Provide a transcript from a school where English is the official language of instruction; or Present a certificate of completion from an approved English as a Second Language (ESL) program.
Requirements: Applicants for the Master of Science in Aeronautics program are required to have a bachelor’s degree from an accredited degree-granting institution with a cumulative grade point average (CGPA) of 2.5 or higher on a 4.0 scale. Applicants who already possess a master’s degree are required to have a 3.0 CGPA or higher at the graduate level. Applicants with an undergraduate CGPA of less than 2.5, or those with a graduate GPA of less than 3.0, must submit official Graduate Record Exam (GRE) scores of 150 or higher on the verbal section and 150 or higher on the quantitative section. Alternatively, applicants may submit official scores from the Graduate Management Admissions Test (GMAT) of 500 or higher. In addition to the documents required for admission to the university, applicants for the Master of Science in Aeronautics program must also submit a statement of purpose, and a resume. Letters of recommendation are not required, but applicants are welcome to submit them.
Description:
The Master of Science in Aeronautics (MSA) has a justly-earned reputation as a broad, technically-oriented professional degree program that has consistently attracted people already established, or seeking to establish, a career in aviation or aerospace. The degree prepares graduates for high-level, leadership positions in government and industry.

The MSA degree is a 30-credit-hour graduate program, offered fully online and at many of our Worldwide Campus locations, that students typically complete in two years. Students are required to take five core courses that cover core aspects of aeronautics, and then select five additional courses from one of several specializations.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Aeronautics with Specialization in Aviation Safety
EnglishScore: English proficiency is required for applicants whose primary language is not English. For on-campus programs (Daytona Beach, Prescott), accepted tests include TOEFL (minimum 79 iBT), IELTS (minimum 6.0), or Duolingo (minimum 105 for Prescott, case-by-case for Daytona Beach). For the Worldwide & Online program, accepted tests are TOEFL (minimum 79 iBT or 550 paper-based) or IELTS (minimum 6.0).
Requirements: To be considered for admission to the Master of Science in Aeronautics program, prospective students should hold a baccalaureate degree from an accredited degree-granting institution. In addition to a completed application package, which should include all of the items listed below, applicants should have a cumulative grade point average (CGPA) of 2.5 or higher on a 4.0 scale. Required documents include: a completed application, official transcripts from all attended academic institutions, a résumé or curriculum vitae (CV), a 250-500 word statement of purpose addressing your career goals, and two letters of recommendation. Graduate Record Exam (GRE) or Graduate Management Admission Test (GMAT) scores are not required.
Description: The Master of Science in Aeronautics (MSA) degree is a broad-based, flexible program designed for the aviation and aerospace professional. The MSA enhances your knowledge and pursuit of opportunity within the industry, covering topics from airport operations to aircraft design and beyond. In this program, students will gain an advanced understanding of aeronautics and the skills required to be a leader in the aviation industry. Our Aviation Safety specialization provides students with the technical skills required in the areas of accident investigation, safety management and human factors in aviation.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Aeronautics with Specialization in Human Factors
EnglishScore: Official scores from an English Language proficiency exam are required for all international applicants whose primary language is not English. Minimum scores required for admission are: TOEFL iBT: 79; IELTS: 6.0; Duolingo: 105; PTE Academic: 53; or completion of ELS Language Center Level 112.
Description: The MSA Human Factors specialization is a multidisciplinary program that applies knowledge of human performance, limitations, and capabilities to the design of systems. The curriculum offers a broad education in the human factors discipline focusing on the human component in the design, development and operation of complex human-machine systems. The program provides graduates with the knowledge and skills necessary to be successful human factors professionals. Graduates are prepared for doctoral level studies in human factors or for a career as a human factors practitioner in government or industry. Program graduates will be qualified for positions in the military, civil and general aviation sectors of the aviation industry as well as other areas such as medical, automotive and nuclear fields.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Aeronautics with Specialization in Aviation Maintenance
EnglishScore: International applicants must demonstrate English proficiency. Embry-Riddle accepts official scores from TOEFL (minimum 79 iBT or 550 PBT), IELTS (minimum 6.0 overall), Duolingo (minimum 105), PTE Academic (minimum 53), or successful completion of ELS Language Centers' Level 112. The requirement may be waived under certain conditions.
Requirements: For admission to the Master of Science in Aeronautics program, students must have a bachelor’s degree with a minimum GPA of 2.5 from an accredited degree-granting institution. Applicants who do not meet this minimum GPA requirement can be considered on an individual basis if they show evidence of potential for success in a graduate program of study. Graduate Record Exam (GRE) or Graduate Management Admissions Test (GMAT) test scores are not required for admission to this program. Prerequisites: Completion of a bachelor's degree. Students are expected to have at least a fundamental understanding of aerodynamics, aircraft performance, propulsion, and structures from their undergraduate program. Students who have not met this prerequisite may be required to take MSA 505.
Description: A leader in aviation education, Embry-Riddle's Master of Science in Aeronautics offers an opportunity for students to not only obtain an advanced, competitive edge in the field, but also to choose a specialization that is tailored to their unique interests and career goals. Students in the Aeronautics master's degree program learn in a dynamic, high-tech environment from faculty who are experts in their fields. Embry-Riddle's alumni network and industry partnerships are a valuable resource for students to leverage when seeking mentorship and career advancement opportunities. The Master of Science in Aeronautics is a broad, flexible program that provides students with a solid technical foundation in aeronautics and the ability to customize their curriculum in one of our diverse areas of specialization.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Aeronautics with Specialization in Aviation Cybersecurity
EnglishScore: For applicants whose primary language is not English, proficiency must be demonstrated. Accepted tests and recommended minimum scores are: TOEFL iBT 79 (or PBT 550), IELTS 6.0, Duolingo 105, or PTE 53. Completion of ELS Language Centers Level 112 is also accepted. Waivers are available for applicants who meet certain criteria.
Requirements: Admission to the Master of Science in Aeronautics (MSA) program requires a bachelor's degree from an accredited degree-granting institution. A cumulative grade point average (CGPA) of 2.5 or higher on a 4.0 scale is required for full admission into the MSA program. Applicants who have a CGPA of less than 2.5 may be considered for provisional admission. In addition to the documents required for admission to the university, applicants should also submit: A current resume; A Statement of Objectives which will serve as the applicant's writing sample; Three letters of recommendation (optional for students with a 3.0 CGPA or higher); Official GRE scores are not required for admission to the Master of Science in Aeronautics program.
Description: The Master of Science in Aeronautics (MSA) degree is a broad, flexible program that allows you to customize your coursework in an area of specialization. With the MSA, you can combine your existing technical expertise with an advanced aeronautics curriculum to prepare for an aviation/aerospace career in fields such as airline management, aviation safety, education, or airport management. The MSA curriculum is built upon a required core of 3 courses: Air Transportation, Aircraft and Spacecraft Development, and Aeronautical Research. These courses prepare students to investigate and solve problems currently facing the aviation and aerospace industries. MSA students then work with their advisors to customize a curriculum that matches their interests and career goals by choosing from a wide variety of electives and an area of specialization.
CostPerCredit: $1,802 per credit hour (Daytona Beach/Prescott) or $820 per credit hour (Worldwide)

ProgramName: Master of Science in Aerospace Business Analytics
EnglishScore: Applicants for whom English is not the primary language must demonstrate proficiency in English through one of the following methods: TOEFL (iBT minimum 79, PBT minimum 550), IELTS (minimum 6.0 overall band score), Duolingo (minimum 105), ELS Language Center (completion of ELS Language Center level 112), Cambridge English Language Assessment (minimum 170), or Pearson PTE Academic (minimum 53).
Description:
The Master of Science in Aerospace Business Analytics degree from Embry-Riddle provides the analytical skills and business acumen necessary to expertly analyze and communicate critical business data to key decision-makers.

Students will develop their quantitative and analytical skills by blending business classes in areas such as finance, economics and statistics with aviation-related courses in subjects such as air transportation management and airline economics.

Embry-Riddle’s unique program emphasizes application over theory by combining the study of aerospace business with data analytics. Students will learn how to approach, analyze and communicate information in order to develop better business practices and results.

Available at Embry-Riddle’s Daytona Beach Campus, this degree is ideal for those who want to use their data and analytical skills to work in the aerospace and aviation sectors. The curriculum is focused on producing expert analysts who possess the creative thinking and problem-solving skills needed to succeed in business.
Accredidation: The Master of Science in Aerospace Business Analytics is accredited by the Association of Collegiate Business Schools and Programs (ACBSP).

ProgramName: Master of Science in Aerospace Engineering
EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English are required to take either the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) or the International English Language Testing System (IELTS). A minimum TOEFL score of 550 (PBT) or 79 (IBT), or an IELTS score of 6.0 is required. Applicants who have attended a school where English is the primary language of instruction may be exempt from this requirement.
Requirements:
An essay or statement of purpose (approximately 1,000 words) describing your professional goals and aspirations.
A professional résumé or curriculum vitae (CV).
Official transcripts from all previously attended colleges and universities.
Letters of Recommendation (three are recommended).
Official Graduate Record Exam (GRE) test scores are recommended for all applicants and required for those seeking a graduate assistantship. The GRE institution code is 5190. GRE scores are optional for graduates of ERAU.
For the MSAE program, quantitative reasoning score of 155 or higher and an analytical writing score of 4.0 or higher are preferred.
The GMAT may be accepted in lieu of the GRE.
Concentration: ['Aerodynamics and Propulsion', 'Structural Mechanics and Materials', 'Guidance, Navigation, and Control']
Description: The Master of Science in Aerospace Engineering program at Embry-Riddle prepares graduates for success in the field of aerospace engineering. The curriculum provides an enhanced understanding and expertise in the disciplines of Aerodynamics & Propulsion, Dynamics & Control, and Structures & Materials. Graduates are ready for careers in design, development, and testing of aerospace vehicles and systems, as well as for doctoral study. The M.S.A.E. program is offered at both the Daytona Beach and Prescott campuses. While the curriculum is identical, each campus offers unique research opportunities and faculty expertise.
ScholarshipAmount: Graduate assistantships offer tuition waivers and stipends; grants up to $1,500/year are available.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Aerospace Engineering with Concentration in Aerodynamics, Propulsion, Computational Aero and Fluid Dynamics, Transition and Turbulence, Aeroacoustics, Heat Transfer, and Combustion
EnglishScore: For international applicants, a minimum Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) iBT score of 79, an International English Language Testing System (IELTS) score of 6.0, or a Duolingo score of 105 is required. Successful completion of ELS Level 112 is also accepted.
Requirements: In addition to university graduate admission requirements, applicants must have a bachelor’s degree in aerospace engineering, mechanical engineering, or a closely related field from an accredited institution. A cumulative grade point average (CGPA) of 3.0 or higher is required. Applicants with a CGPA below 3.0 may be considered for admission on a case-by-case basis. The Graduate Record Examination (GRE) is not required for admission. Students with degrees in other engineering disciplines, physics, or mathematics may be required to complete prerequisite courses before being fully admitted to the program.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Aerospace Engineering with Concentration in Dynamics and Control
EnglishScore: For international applicants, English Language Proficiency must be demonstrated by one of the following methods: a minimum TOEFL score of 79 iBT (or 550 PBT), a minimum IELTS score of 6.0, a minimum Duolingo score of 105, or successful completion of an ELS Language Center's intensive program at Level 112. Other methods of proving proficiency are also accepted.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Aerospace Engineering with Concentration in Structures and Materials
EnglishScore: Applicants whose primary language is not English must either: Earn a minimum score on the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) of 79 on the internet-based test (iBT) or 550 on the paper-based test (PBT). Earn a minimum score of 6.0 on the International English Language Testing System (IELTS). Earn a minimum score of 53 on the Pearson Test of English (PTE) Academic. Successfully complete an English Language course through an approved language partner (ELS, EC, etc.). Earn a minimum score of 105 on the Duolingo English Test (DET).
Requirements: Applicants for the Master of Science in Aerospace Engineering program must have a bachelor’s degree from an accredited degree-granting institution with a cumulative grade point average (CGPA) of 3.0 or higher on a 4.0 scale. The Graduate Record Examination (GRE) is recommended for all applicants and required for all applicants seeking a graduate assistantship. The GRE is also required for applicants with a CGPA below 3.0 and for applicants with a degree from a non-ABET accredited program.
Description: The Master of Science in Aerospace Engineering (M.S.A.E.) degree gives students the opportunity to enhance their skills in the design, development, and testing of aircraft and spacecraft. Students at Embry-Riddle Aeronautical University are able to specialize their degree, preparing them for the demands of the ever-evolving aerospace and aviation industry. The M.S.A.E. degree is housed in the Department of Aerospace Engineering in the College of Engineering. Students will have the opportunity to specialize their studies in one of three areas: Aerodynamics and Propulsion, Dynamics and Control, or Structures and Materials. This specialized degree program allows students to build on their engineering skills and become a more valuable asset in their field.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Airline Management
EnglishScore: Applicants for whom English is not the primary language must either: Attain a minimum score on the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) of 550 (paper-based) or 79 (Internet-based). OR Attain a minimum score on the International English Language Testing System (IELTS) of 6.0. OR Attain a minimum score on the Duolingo English Test of 105. OR Successfully complete an English Language course (ESL) at an accredited post-secondary institution.
ScholarshipType: New Student Scholarship, Family Grant, Graduation Scholarship

ProgramName: Master of Science in Airport and Air Mobility Management
EnglishScore: International applicants must prove English Language Proficiency. Accepted tests include TOEFL iBT (79), TOEFL PBT (550), IELTS (6.0), Duolingo (105), or Pearson PTE Academic (53). Successful completion of ELS Level 112 is also accepted. Exemptions may apply.
Department: David B. O'Maley College of Business
Description: The Master of Science in Airport and Air Mobility Management is designed to equip students with the skills and knowledge necessary to successfully lead, manage and operate airports and related businesses in the 21st century. The program curriculum includes a core component that integrates foundational business and aviation principles with a strong focus on airport operations, planning and management. Students will learn the interrelationships of the various components of the airport environment and its associated air mobility ecosystem. Students will also be exposed to strategic issues impacting the industry. These topics include accommodating new entrants, enhancing passenger experience, ensuring safety and security, and increasing efficiency and revenue generation, while maintaining a commitment to social and environmental responsibility.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Airworthiness Engineering
EnglishScore: Proof of English proficiency is required of all applicants whose primary language is not English. Any of the following are acceptable: Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) score of 79 iBT (internet-based test) or 550 PBT (paper-based test); International English Language Test System (IELTS) score of 6.0; Duolingo score of 105; Completion of an approved ESL program (ex. ELS Level 112); A transcript from a secondary school, college, or university where English is the official language of instruction.
Requirements: To be considered for this program, applicants must have a bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution with a minimum cumulative grade point average (CGPA) of 2.5 on a 4.0 scale. Applicants must submit official transcripts from all institutions attended, a résumé or curriculum vitae (CV), a Statement of Objectives (500-1000 words), and the names and contact information for two recommenders.
Description:
The Master of Science in Airworthiness Engineering (MSAE) degree is for students who want to design and certify new aircraft. This degree provides a solid foundation of engineering knowledge and skills necessary for a successful career in the airworthiness engineering field.

With a curriculum that focuses on the practical application of engineering, the program equips students with the knowledge needed for the design, development and certification of safe aircraft. Students will also gain an understanding of airworthiness engineering processes and the regulations that govern the aircraft industry.

Students who already have a degree in aerospace, mechanical or another related engineering field and are interested in the design, development and certification of aircraft will benefit from this unique program.

The MSAE program is housed in the Department of Aerospace Engineering in the College of Engineering. It’s a 30-credit-hour program that includes an option for a thesis or a non-thesis track.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Aviation
EnglishScore: For applicants for whom English is not their primary language, a minimum score is required on one of the following tests: TOEFL (79 iBT or 550 PBT), IELTS (6.0), Duolingo (105), or Pearson VUE (53). Completion of an approved English as a Second Language (ESL) program, such as the ELS Language Centers program at Level 112, may also be accepted.
Requirements: Applicants for admission to the Master of Science in Aviation program must have a bachelor's degree from an accredited institution with a minimum grade point average (GPA) of 2.5. Required application documents include official transcripts from all institutions attended, three letters of recommendation, a resume, and a statement of purpose. Graduate Record Exam (GRE) scores are required if the applicant's cumulative undergraduate GPA is below a 3.0.
Concentration: ['Aviation Management', 'Aviation Safety Management Systems', 'Unmanned Aircraft Systems', 'Space Operations', 'Aviation/Aerospace Sustainability', 'Air Traffic Management', 'Aviation/Aerospace Operations']
Description: The Master of Science in Aviation (MSA) degree provides students with a technical and specialized professional education about aviation. Students gain an in-depth, comprehensive and commanding knowledge of aviation and are prepared for a variety of leadership roles in the industry. The program is best suited for students who want to advance their knowledge and career in aviation, but it is also suitable for professionals in other fields looking for a transition into aviation. Students in the program explore all facets of the aerospace industry, including air traffic management, airport design and development, airline operations, aviation safety and security, and aircraft maintenance management. The curriculum also delves into the legal, regulatory, and labor aspects of the industry, as well as environmental issues and challenges. This comprehensive approach provides graduates with the knowledge and skills needed to succeed in various aviation roles, such as airline manager, airport manager, air traffic controller, aviation safety inspector, and aviation consultant. With an MSA degree from Embry-Riddle, graduates are well-equipped to advance their careers and make a significant impact in the aviation industry.
Accredidation: The Master of Science in Aviation is accredited by the Aviation Accreditation Board International (AABI).

ProgramName: Master of Business Administration in Aviation Management
EnglishScore: International applicants must be proficient in English. If English is not your primary language, you must either: Submit official scores for the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), the International English Language Testing System (IELTS) academic, or Duolingo. Have attended a school at the secondary level or above for at least one year where English is the language of instruction. Successfully complete the English Language Services (ELS) Level 112.
Requirements: Applicants must submit the following items to be considered for admission into the MBAA program: A completed graduate application for admission. A professional résumé. Three letters of recommendation (required from individuals with whom you have had a professional or academic relationship). A statement of objectives (essay). Official transcripts from all previously attended colleges and universities. Official Graduate Management Admissions Test (GMAT) or Graduate Record Exam (GRE) scores.
Department: David B. O'Maley College of Business
Description: The Master of Business Administration in Aviation Management (MBA-AM) degree from Embry-Riddle Aeronautical University provides a strong foundation for success in any facet of the global aviation business world. The MBA-AM degree provides a traditional business skill set but has a unique focus on aviation and aerospace industries. Students with a technical background get the business acumen they need to become managers and executives while those with a business background learn the ins-and-outs of the highly specialized aviation industry. The MBA-AM degree is offered completely online, allowing you to tailor your education to your schedule. Many faculty members have years of experience working in the aviation industry, and class sizes are small so you'll receive the individual attention you deserve. The MBA-AM degree has a wide variety of career opportunities, and we have the tools to help you reach your goals.
Accredidation: This program is accredited by the Accreditation Council for Business Schools and Programs (ACBSP).

ProgramName: Master of Science in Computer Science
EnglishScore: Applicants from countries where English is not the official language must demonstrate English proficiency by one of the following methods: TOEFL (minimum score of 79 on the internet-based test or 550 on the paper-based test), IELTS (minimum overall band score of 6.0), Duolingo (minimum score of 105), or completion of ELS Level 112 with a GPA of 3.0 or higher.
Requirements: The admission requirements for the Master of Science in Computer Science degree are a bachelor's degree in computer science, software engineering, computer engineering, or electrical engineering with a computer option, from an accredited institution with a cumulative grade point average (CGPA) of 3.0 or higher. Applicants who do not possess a degree in one of the areas mentioned above may be considered for admission if they have an undergraduate degree in a related field such as mathematics, physics, or another engineering discipline with a CGPA of 3.0 or higher. However, these applicants must demonstrate proficiency by successfully completing (with a grade of B or better) the following foundational undergraduate courses: Computer Programming I & II, Data Structures and Algorithms, Operating Systems, Computer Organization and Architecture, and Discrete Mathematics. Some or all of these foundational courses may be satisfied through a diagnostic exam upon approval from the graduate program coordinator.
Description: The Master of Science in Computer Science (MSCS) is a 30-credit-hour program that provides students with strong foundations and professionally oriented and advanced technical skills in computer science. The program is specifically designed to enable students to pursue leadership positions in computer science in the business, industrial, governmental and educational sectors. Students will not only be engaged in theoretical studies, but they will gain hands-on experience by applying those studies to real-world projects. The Computer Science master's degree program is housed in the Department of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science in the College of Engineering.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Data Science
EnglishScore: Applicants from countries where English is not the official language must demonstrate English proficiency by providing a score from one of the following: Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), International English Language Testing System (IELTS), Duolingo, or the Cambridge English Language Assessment. Applicants may be exempt from submitting a proficiency score if they have successfully completed an English as a Second Language (ESL) program at an accredited institution, or have earned a degree from an institution in which English was the primary language of instruction.
Requirements: A bachelor's degree from an accredited institution with a cumulative grade point average (CGPA) of 3.0 or higher on a 4.0 scale is required. Applicants with a CGPA between 2.5 and 2.99 will be considered on an individual basis. Two letters of recommendation are required. Official transcripts from all previously attended colleges and universities are required. Graduate Record Examination (GRE) scores are not required but are recommended for applicants who do not meet the minimum CGPA requirement.
Description:
The Master of Science in Data Science degree at Embry-Riddle prepares its students for careers that apply data analysis, visualization, and machine learning to solve real-world problems. The program is inherently interdisciplinary, focusing on the application of data science to business intelligence, aviation, and aerospace.

The curriculum combines a core of data science theory and methods with three specializations for students to explore their interests: Aviation & Aerospace, Business Analytics, and Cybersecurity.

Students will use modern techniques and tools in programming, statistics, machine learning, and data management to store, process, analyze, manage, and visualize big data. They will also build the skills to communicate the results of their analyses to a broad audience.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Engineering Management
EnglishScore: If English is not your primary language, you must submit an official score from one of the following: Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), International English Language Testing System (IELTS), Duolingo English Test, Pearson Test of English (PTE), Cambridge English Language Assessment. The English proficiency requirement may be waived if a student has successfully completed an English composition course with a grade of "B" or better from a regionally accredited U.S. institution or if the student is from an English-speaking country.
Requirements:
To be considered for admission to the Master of Science in Engineering Management program, applicants are required to have:

- Earned a bachelor’s degree with a minimum Grade Point Average (GPA) of 2.5 (on a 4.0 scale) from an accredited degree-granting institution.
- An undergraduate degree in engineering or a related discipline. Applicants without an engineering degree or a related discipline will be required to complete prerequisite courses before full admittance into the program.
- A statement of objectives that addresses the applicant’s reasons for wanting to pursue a graduate degree in engineering management and how that degree will assist them in achieving their professional goals. This statement should also include any other relevant information that will help the department make an admission decision.
- A professional resume that summarizes the applicant’s work history and any professional training, licensures, or certificates that have been earned.

Standardized tests (such as the GRE/GMAT) are not required for admission.
Description: The Master of Science in Engineering Management degree is designed for experienced professionals from a variety of engineering disciplines who want to advance into management roles. Today’s engineering managers need to possess both technical expertise and business acumen to successfully lead teams and projects, and the curriculum is specifically designed to meet this demand. Students will acquire specialized skills in finance, marketing, human resources, and project management in combination with systems engineering, quality control, and supply chain management. Graduates will be equipped to manage technical teams, complex projects, and global operations in a variety of industries, including aerospace, manufacturing, and technology.
Accredidation: Embry-Riddle Aeronautical University is accredited by the Southern Association of Colleges and Schools Commission on Colleges (SACSCOC) to award degrees at the associate, baccalaureate, masters and doctorate levels.
ScholarshipType: Institutional grants, Alumni scholarships, Family grants

ProgramName: Master of Science in Human Factors
EnglishScore: International applicants for whom English is not the primary language must either: Attain a minimum score on the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) of 550 (PBT) or 79 (IBT); OR Attain a minimum score on the International English Language Testing System (IELTS) of 6.0; OR Earn transferable credit for a course that is the equivalent of ENGL 123 (English Composition) at an accredited postsecondary institution; OR Successfully complete a course of study at an ELS Language Center.
Requirements:
Applicants for the Master of Science in Human Factors program are expected to have a bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution. Those with a bachelor’s degree in psychology, engineering, or a related discipline are encouraged to apply. Those with an undergraduate degree in another discipline may need to complete prerequisites. All applicants must submit the following:

An application form and application fee.
Official transcripts from all colleges and universities attended.
Three letters of recommendation.
A résumé or curriculum vitae.
A statement of objectives (essay).

GRE (Graduate Record Exam) scores are required. Applicants are expected to have a minimum verbal score of 150, a quantitative score of 150, and an analytical writing score of 3.5. These score minimums will be waived for applicants having a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher from their bachelor’s degree institution, and for graduates of any ERAU undergraduate degree program. Applicants who wish to be considered for a Graduate Assistantship position are strongly encouraged to submit GRE scores.
Concentration: ['Human Factors in Aviation', 'Human Factors in Systems Engineering', 'Human Factors in User Experience']
Description:
The Master of Science in Human Factors is an online degree that focuses on optimizing human performance and safety through the design of systems, products and work environments.

The 30-credit-hour program builds on the foundations of human factors and allows students to explore areas related to their specific interests through one of three specializations.

At Embry-Riddle, students receive a world-class education from highly knowledgeable faculty who have decades of practical industry experience.

The curriculum focuses on both the theoretical and practical application of human factors and is designed for working professionals who want to advance their careers and leadership roles.

The program culminates in a human factors capstone project where students will work with faculty to research and solve a real-world problem.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Human Security and Resilience
EnglishScore: International applicants are required to have English Language proficiency scores.
Description: The Master of Science in Human Security & Resilience (MSHSR) is an online 30-credit-hour program that prepares graduates to analyze and respond to a wide array of man-made and natural threats to human security. The program provides students with an in-depth understanding of the major theories and practices in the fields of security and resilience. The core curriculum provides a solid foundation in the key areas of the discipline, to include: security policy and practice, hazard mitigation and resilience, research methods and analytical techniques. The MSHSR degree prepares students for careers in government, the private sector and non-governmental organizations with a focus on national and international security. Students will be well-positioned to pursue advanced doctoral studies in a wide array of fields, including security studies, international relations, political science, public policy and criminal justice. The M.S. in Human Security & Resilience degree program is part of ERAU’s Security and Emergency Services department in the College of Arts and Sciences.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Management
EnglishScore: Applicants from countries where English is not the primary language must demonstrate English proficiency by one of the following methods: Completion of the ELS Language Centers' (ELS) Level 112 with a 2.5 GPA or higher; Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) score of: 79 iBT (internet based test) or 550 PBT (paper based test); International English Language Testing System (IELTS) score of 6.0; Duolingo English Test (DET) with a score of 105; Pearson PTE Academic score of 53; Cambridge English Scale score of 170.
Requirements: The Master of Science in Management (MSM) program is open to students from all undergraduate disciplines. No prior business courses are required. To be considered for admission, applicants must have a bachelor’s degree with a cumulative grade point average (CGPA) of 2.5 or higher from an accredited degree-granting institution. Applicants with a CGPA of less than 2.5 may be considered for conditional admission.
Concentration: Engineering Management, Global Management, Leadership, Operations Management
Description: The Master of Science in Management (MSM) degree program provides students with a quality, graduate-level learning experience that will equip them with the skills and abilities to manage and lead organizations effectively. The MSM program is a 30-credit-hour graduate degree program that focuses on management and leadership skills. Experienced managers and technical professionals from all disciplines will benefit from the program, as it has been designed to provide the necessary skills and knowledge for a leader in any technical-oriented business. The program equips graduates to oversee and manage diverse teams, projects and processes to reach organizational goals. Coursework within the program develops a student’s core competency and proficiency in the areas of accounting, finance, economics, human resources, marketing, business development, leadership and project management. Students will be able to customize their degree with a specialization in Engineering Management, Global Management, Leadership or Operations Management.
Accredidation: The Master of Science in Management is accredited by the Accreditation Council for Business Schools and Programs (ACBSP).
ScholarshipType: New Student Scholarship, Continuation Scholarship, Alumni Scholarship

ProgramName: Master of Science in Mechanical Engineering
EnglishScore: Applicants from countries where English is not the official language must submit a score from the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), the International English Language Testing System (IELTS), or Duolingo English Test. Successful completion of an ELS Language Center course (Level 112) with a recommendation from the ELS Center Director may also be used to satisfy the English proficiency requirement.
Requirements: A completed application. A bachelor's degree in mechanical engineering, aerospace engineering, or a closely related field from an accredited institution. A cumulative grade point average (CGPA) of 3.0 or higher on a 4.0 scale. Applicants who possess a bachelor's degree in a discipline other than those mentioned above (e.g., mathematics, physics, or other engineering disciplines) may be required to complete undergraduate-level prerequisite coursework before being fully admitted to the program. The prerequisite courses are not credited toward the degree. Official transcripts from all previously attended colleges and universities are required. International students may have additional requirements. GRE scores are optional for applicants that meet the CGPA requirement.
Concentration: High-Performance Vehicles, Robotics and Unmanned Autonomous Systems
Description:
With a Master of Science in Mechanical Engineering (MSME), students can either broaden their mechanical engineering education or focus on a specific area of interest. At Embry-Riddle, students are encouraged to innovate and explore a multitude of mechanical engineering fields, such as robotics, unmanned vehicles, space systems, energy, and biomedical systems. The MSME program is focused on advanced topics within mechanical engineering, and our state-of-the-art labs and facilities ensure students have access to the tools they need for in-depth research and development.
The MSME program is offered at both the Daytona Beach Campus and the Prescott Campus and is housed in the Department of Mechanical Engineering in the College of Engineering.
Students will learn from experienced faculty who share their expertise in fields such as:
Robotics
Energy systems
Unmanned autonomous systems
High-performance vehicles
Advanced materials and manufacturing
Spacecraft systems
The Daytona Beach Campus offers thesis and non-thesis options, with specializations available in High-Performance Vehicles and Robotics and Unmanned Autonomous Systems.
The Prescott Campus offers a thesis option only.
The program’s objective is to produce graduates who have in-depth knowledge of mechanical engineering and can creatively apply their knowledge to the synthesis, design and analysis of complex systems for aerospace and general engineering applications.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Occupational Safety Management
EnglishScore: Applicants whose primary language is not English must demonstrate English proficiency by providing an official score report of the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), International English Language Testing System (IELTS), or Duolingo English Test. A minimum score of 79 on the internet based TOEFL (iBT), or 6.0 on the IELTS is required. On the Duolingo English Test, a minimum score of 105 is required for admission. Students who have earned a degree from an institution where English is the primary language of instruction are not required to submit a proof of English proficiency test score.
Description: The Master of Science in Occupational Safety Management is for students with an undergraduate background in occupational safety or a related field. The 30-credit program is designed to provide students with the knowledge to establish and manage occupational safety programs within various professional environments, such as aviation, military and manufacturing. The degree program offers a unique experience to students by allowing them to work with the latest technologies while learning from faculty members who are industry experts and have firsthand knowledge of working in the field. Students will get hands-on experience and learn to apply their knowledge to solve critical industry challenges. Upon completing this program, graduates will have the necessary skills to effectively manage safety programs within the industry of their choice. This degree also provides a competitive edge for working professionals who are seeking advancement in their careers.
Accredidation: The Master of Science in Occupational Safety Management degree is accredited by the Aviation Accreditation Board International (AABI).

ProgramName: Master of Science in Space Operations
EnglishScore: Applicants for whom English is not their primary language must either: Attest to being a native English speaker OR Submit scores from the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), the International English Language Testing System (IELTS), or Duolingo. A minimum score of 79 on the internet-based TOEFL (iBT), or 550 on the paper-based TOEFL (PBT). A minimum total score of 6.0 on the IELTS. A minimum score of 105 on Duolingo. Successful completion of ELS Language Centers' Level 112.
Description:
The Master of Science in Space Operations (M.S.S.O.) is an exciting and unique program that provides students with a broad and deep understanding of the space environment, space systems and space operations. The program is designed for students who want to work in the military, government or commercial space sectors as space systems operators, managers, analysts, or policymakers. The M.S.S.O. program is a 30-credit-hour program that can be completed in as little as 18 months. The program is offered completely online, allowing for maximum flexibility for students who are working professionals or who are geographically dispersed.

The M.S.S.O. is tailored to both the military and civilian professional looking to master all aspects of space systems, from the policies and laws that govern their use to the technical understanding of how space systems are designed and operated. Students in the Space Operations degree program will learn about orbital mechanics, space environment, spacecraft systems, space operations, space policy and law, space systems management and space systems applications.

The program culminates in a capstone project that allows students to apply their knowledge and skills to a real-world space operations problem.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Systems Engineering
Term: Fall, Spring (Residential); January, March, May, June, August, October (Worldwide)
EnglishScore: Applicants for whom English is not the primary language must demonstrate proficiency by one of the following methods: Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) iBT (minimum score 79), International English Language Testing System (IELTS) academic test (minimum score 6.0), Duolingo English test (minimum score 105), Pearson Vue English test (minimum score 53), or successful completion of an English language course (ELS Language Centers Level 112) with a certificate.
Department: College of Engineering (Daytona Beach/Prescott), College of Aeronautics (Worldwide)
Description:
The Master of Science in Systems Engineering (MSSE) degree program at Embry-Riddle is focused on preparing students for an exciting career designing and managing complex engineering projects. The curriculum provides a strong foundation in systems engineering and management with a focus on meeting the needs of the industry.

The 30-credit-hour program provides a strong foundation and bridges multiple disciplines. Students will explore all aspects of systems, including requirements definition, system design and development, and systems verification and validation. Students will learn the tools and techniques to manage complex systems both from a technical and management perspective.

Embry-Riddle's Systems Engineering graduates are prepared to create and execute complex projects that require broad technical and management backgrounds. They have been hired by a wide range of companies, including Rockwell Collins, The Boeing Company, and The Federal Aviation Administration.
CostPerCredit: $1,812 per credit hour (Residential) / $825 per credit hour (Worldwide)

ProgramName: Master of Science in Uncrewed Systems
EnglishScore: Applicants for whom English is not the primary language must submit official results from one of the following internationally recognized English language proficiency tests: Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), International English Language Testing System (IELTS), or Duolingo English Test.
Description: The Embry-Riddle Master of Science in Uncrewed Systems (MSUS) is a non-engineering degree that focuses on this emerging industry by addressing topics including policy, ethics, design, and management. This degree program prepares students for leadership and management positions that require industry expertise. Graduates of this program will be equipped with the knowledge and skills necessary to manage uncrewed systems programs over their life cycle, including their design and development, operation and management, and policy issues. The MSUS degree program is housed in the Department of Graduate Studies within the College of Aeronautics.

ProgramName: PhD in Aerospace Engineering
EnglishScore: If the applicant's master's degree is from an institution where the primary language of instruction is not English, then the applicant must either earn a minimum score on the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) of 550 (paper-based) or 79 (Internet-based), or a minimum score on the International English Language Testing System (IELTS) of 6.0. This English proficiency requirement can be waived if the applicant successfully completes the English for Academic Purposes Program (EAPP) offered by the Embry-Riddle Language Institute (ERLI).
Requirements: The Ph.D. in Aerospace Engineering program seeks to attract students who have already earned a Master of Science in Aerospace Engineering or a closely related engineering field. A Bachelor of Science degree may be considered for exceptional applicants. The ideal applicant should possess a graduate GPA of 3.5 or higher on a 4.0 scale. GRE scores will be considered for all applicants.
Concentration: ['Aerodynamics and Propulsion', 'Dynamics and Control', 'Structures and Materials']
Description: The Doctor of Philosophy in Aerospace Engineering degree program at Embry-Riddle focuses on theoretical and practical training for those interested in performing and managing original and leading-edge research. The degree prepares graduates for careers in research and development in industry, academia and government. The curriculum is broad and flexible, emphasizing both theoretical studies and hands-on, practical applications. The program allows for a choice of three areas of specialization: Aerodynamics and Propulsion, Dynamics and Control, and Structures and Materials. These areas represent the major disciplines in aerospace engineering. The Ph.D. in Aerospace Engineering program at ERAU is housed in the Department of Aerospace Engineering in the College of Engineering. The Ph.D. degree has a strong research focus and is a key initiative to help elevate the university to a national level of prominence in engineering and research. The program also supports the university’s goal to build a strong graduate studies and research enterprise.

ProgramName: PhD in Aviation
LiveDate: Applications are typically available online one year prior to the desired start term. For Fall 2026, this would be approximately August 2025.
DeadlineDate: The priority application deadline for fall admission is January 15. For Fall 2026 admission, the deadline would be January 15, 2026.
EnglishScore: All applicants whose primary language is not English must submit a satisfactory score on an approved English language proficiency exam. Embry-Riddle Aeronautical University accepts several exams including TOEFL, IELTS, Duolingo, ELS Level 112, and PTE. Applicants can submit any one of these to satisfy the requirement.
Description: The Ph.D. in Aviation program helps students with an established background in aviation prepare to become leading researchers and scholars who can make significant contributions to the field of aviation. This degree gives candidates the skills to solve current problems facing the aviation industry and the ability to define future needs. The program is designed to develop highly skilled researchers who have a broad knowledge of aviation and a deep theoretical understanding of a specific area of interest. Students may focus their studies on one of three specializations: Aviation Safety and Human Factors, Operations, or an Interdisciplinary specialization. In addition to rigorous, research-based coursework, students must complete a comprehensive examination and a dissertation showing mastery of a specific subject area. Upon graduation, Ph.D. in Aviation students are prepared for careers as university faculty, industry and government leaders, and senior researchers.
ScholarshipAmount: Select students may be offered a Graduate Research Assistantship which includes a stipend of $22,000 for the academic year plus a tuition waiver.

ProgramName: PhD in Aviation with Specialization in Aviation Safety
EnglishScore: International applicants must meet all admission requirements noted above. In addition, they must meet one of the following requirements for English language proficiency: Provide official scores from the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) or International English Language Testing System (IELTS) that meet the minimum requirements: TOEFL: a minimum score of 80 for the Internet-based test (iBT); IELTS: a minimum overall score of 6.0.
Requirements:
Admission to the Ph.D. in Aviation program is competitive. Applicants will be evaluated by the Ph.D. in Aviation Admission Committee. An applicant who satisfies the minimum requirements is not guaranteed admission.
To be considered for admission, applicants must satisfy the following:
1. Hold a master’s degree from an accredited institution with a cumulative grade point average (CGPA) of 3.25 or higher on a 4.0 scale.
    * Applicants without a master’s degree must have completed a bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution with a CGPA of 3.5 or higher and have an acceptable GRE score (155 verbal and 155 quantitative). They must complete a master’s degree before beginning the Ph.D. program. Contact the program chair for more details.
2. Submit official transcripts from all previously attended colleges and universities.
3. Complete a graduate application.
4. Submit a comprehensive resume of professional experience.
5. Provide a statement of purpose that includes the applicant's research interests. This statement should be uploaded to the student portal after submitting the application.
6. Submit three letters of recommendation that speak to the applicant’s ability to conduct doctoral-level research.
7. Submit a writing sample of high quality. Examples include a published article or a master’s thesis.
Description:
The Ph.D. in Aviation degree program at Embry-Riddle's Daytona Beach Campus provides students with a research-based curriculum within a diverse, intellectually versatile, and multi-disciplinary environment. Students will be a part of a program that moves them beyond a dissertation as they position themselves to make a significant contribution to their field.

The university fosters a highly research-oriented, inquiry-based approach to education in which faculty mentor students who share a passion for aviation and a desire to conduct original research. The program prepares its graduates for careers as university faculty and researchers, or as leaders in government and industry.

Through a commitment to research and teaching, Ph.D. students will have an opportunity to make a lasting impact on the future of the aviation industry. Specializing in Aviation Safety and Security, Aviation Operations, or in an intradisciplinary combination of the two, the program gives students the chance to pursue their topics of interest.

ProgramName: PhD in Aviation with Specialization in Aviation Human Factors
EnglishScore: International applicants whose primary language is not English must demonstrate English language proficiency. Embry-Riddle accepts several exams, including TOEFL iBT (minimum score 80), IELTS (minimum score 6.5), and Duolingo (minimum score 105).
Requirements:
Admission to the Ph.D. in Aviation program is selective and competitive. Applicants are required to have:
- Completed application for admission to the Ph.D. in Aviation program.
- A master's degree from an accredited institution with a minimum cumulative grade point average (CGPA) of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale. Applicants who do not possess a master's degree can apply to one of the college's MS programs and indicate on the application their interest in the Ph.D. program.
- Official transcripts from all post-secondary institutions attended.
- A current resume or curriculum vitae (CV).
- A statement of purpose (essay) that carefully and specifically addresses the applicant's background and interest in pursuing a doctoral degree in aviation at Embry-Riddle Aeronautical University. The essay should include the applicant's goals and objectives, and which of the Embry-Riddle faculty members they have an interest in working with and why.
- Three letters of recommendation are required to be submitted with the application.
- Official Graduate Record Examination (GRE) scores taken within five years. The verbal reasoning score must be 153 or higher, the quantitative reasoning score must be 152 or higher, and the analytical writing score must be a 4.0 or higher. A waiver of the GRE requirement may be granted for applicants who have a previously earned doctoral degree.
- For international applicants, a Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) score of 80 on the internet-based (iBT) test, 6.5 on the International English Language Testing System (IELTS), or a 105 on the Duolingo English test may be required.
Description: The Ph.D. in Aviation program at Embry-Riddle’s Daytona Beach Campus provides students with a cognitive and culturally diverse research-driven curriculum that is focused on addressing the problems facing the aviation field. The Ph.D. in Aviation program prepares students to become scholar-practitioners, leading and serving the aviation industry as researchers, consultants, leaders and educators. Through this program, students have the chance to make a lasting impact on the aviation field.
ScholarshipAmount: $20,000-$28,000 stipend plus full tuition for the academic year

ProgramName: PhD in Aviation with Specialization in Aviation Operations
EnglishScore: Non-native English speakers must demonstrate proficiency. Accepted tests and minimum scores include: TOEFL iBT (79) or PBT (550), IELTS (6.0), Duolingo English Test (105), or Pearson PTE Academic (53).
Description: The Ph.D. in Aviation program at Embry-Riddle Aeronautical University is designed to prepare students with cognitive research skills to solve acute problems facing the field of aviation and advance the discipline. Through the Ph.D. program, students have the chance to pursue the discipline in a diverse, intellectually versatile and multi-disciplinary environment. Embry-Riddle Aeronautical University offers this program online and at our Daytona Beach campus. This flexibility brings the quality of an Embry-Riddle education to you, no matter where you are in the world. The Ph.D. in Aviation program is geared toward aviation professionals, including flight crew members, air traffic controllers, airline technical representatives, aviation maintenance managers, government employees and aviation educators who are looking to take their careers to the next level. Students will gain the knowledge and research skills that are required for leadership roles in academia, government agencies and the aviation/aerospace industry.
Accredidation: Embry-Riddle Aeronautical University is accredited by the Southern Association of Colleges and Schools Commission on Colleges (SACSCOC) to award degrees at the associate, baccalaureate, masters, and doctorate levels.

ProgramName: PhD in Aviation with Specialization in Intradisciplinary
EnglishScore:
Applicants must meet one of the following requirements:
Have earned a degree (bachelor’s, master’s or doctoral) from a U.S. regionally accredited institution.
Have earned a degree (bachelor’s, master’s or doctoral) from an institution of higher education outside the U.S. in which English is the official language of the country and the language of instruction in which the degree was earned.
Submit an official test score report from one of our approved English language proficiency exams showing that the minimum score requirement has been met. The minimum score requirements for the Ph.D. in Aviation are listed below:
TOEFL (Test of English as a Foreign Language) iBT format: 80
IELTS (International English Language Testing System): 6.5
PTE (Pearson Test of English) Academic: 55
Duolingo: 110
Requirements: Admission to the Ph.D. in Aviation program is competitive. Applicants must hold a master's degree from an accredited institution. Applicants who already hold a doctorate degree may apply. A minimum graduate level GPA of 3.0 is recommended. Since this is an online program, applicants who are not native English speakers must demonstrate English proficiency through one of the approved methods listed on the international admissions page. Due to the research-intensive nature of the Ph.D. program, applicants are expected to have some prior research experience as shown through completion of a thesis or other significant research project. Applicants without thesis/significant research project experience will be considered, but may be required to complete GRAD 700 prior to full admission to the Ph.D. program. The Graduate Record Examination (GRE) is not required for admission. However, submission of scores from the GRE or the Graduate Management Admissions Test (GMAT) will enhance a candidate's application package.
Description: The Ph.D. in Aviation degree program at Embry-Riddle is designed to prepare students with cognitive research skills to solve acute problems facing the field of aviation and to advance the discipline. The Ph.D. in Aviation program produces outstanding scholars to lead in the field of aviation. Through this program, students have the chance to pursue a passion for aviation in a diverse, intellectually versatile, and multidisciplinary environment. The program, which is STEM-based, is geared to both full-time and working-professional students and is available on campus in Daytona Beach, Florida, or online through our Worldwide Campus. Students in the Ph.D. in Aviation program can pursue one of three specializations: Aviation Safety and Human Factors, Aviation Operations, or Intradisciplinary. The program requires 60 credit hours beyond a master's degree.
ScholarshipAmount: Up to $2,500 per year for grants; Assistantships provide a full tuition waiver plus a stipend.

ProgramName: Doctor of Aviation Business Administration
EnglishScore: For international applicants, a TOEFL score of 80 (iBT) or 6.5 IELTS is required.
Requirements:
The following are the minimum requirements for admission to the Doctor of Aviation Business Administration (D.A.B.A.) program.

Possess a Master’s degree in a business or aviation-related discipline from an accredited institution with a minimum cumulative grade point average (CGPA) of 3.5 on a 4.0 scale.
Have a minimum of three years full-time, professional experience in the aviation/aerospace industry or a business-related field.
Submit a two-page statement of purpose (double-spaced) that addresses the applicant’s background, career goals, and reason for pursuing the D.A.B.A. degree.
Submit a detailed résumé or curriculum vitae that outlines the applicant’s academic and professional experience.
Submit three letters of recommendation from individuals who are well-acquainted with the applicant’s academic and/or professional performance.
Submit official transcripts from all previously attended colleges and universities.
Submit an original writing sample (e.g., published article, research paper) authored by the applicant that demonstrates the applicant’s analytical and writing skills.
Description:
The Embry-Riddle Doctor of Aviation Business Administration (D.A.B.A) is the first of its kind in the nation. It is designed for experienced professionals looking to further their knowledge and skills in the field of aviation business. This terminal degree program provides students with a rigorous, research-based curriculum that prepares them for leadership roles in the aviation industry.

The D.A.B.A. program has three primary objectives. First, it will provide students with a strong foundation in aviation business theory and practice. Second, it will develop students’ research and analytical skills so they can identify and solve complex problems in the aviation industry. Third, it will prepare students for leadership roles in the aviation industry by teaching them how to effectively manage people, resources and projects.

Students in the D.A.B.A. program will learn about a wide range of topics, including aviation finance, marketing, operations, and strategy. They will also learn how to conduct research and write scholarly papers. Upon graduation, students will be prepared to pursue careers as executives, consultants, and researchers in the aviation industry.
Accredidation: The Doctor of Aviation Business Administration program is accredited by the Accreditation Council for Business Schools and Programs (ACBSP).

ProgramName: PhD in Electrical Engineering & Computer Science
EnglishScore: Students for whom English is not their primary language must demonstrate English proficiency by one of the following methods: a minimum score of 79 on the TOEFL iBT (Test of English as a Foreign Language, Internet-based test) or 550 on the TOEFL PBT (paper-based test); a minimum score of 6.0 on the IELTS (International English Language Testing System); a minimum score of 105 on the Duolingo English Test; a minimum score of 170 on the Cambridge English Language Assessment; or successful completion of an ELS (English Language Services) Language Center program, with a certificate of completion of level 112.
Requirements:
To be considered for admission to the Ph.D. in Electrical Engineering & Computer Science program, applicants must meet the general admissions requirements for the university. In addition, the EECS Department requires the following:

*   A master’s degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or a closely related field from an accredited institution with a minimum cumulative GPA of 3.5.
*   Official transcripts are required from all previously attended colleges and universities.
*   Three letters of recommendation are required.
*   Statement of Objectives.
*   GRE required. Applicants may petition for a waiver of the GRE requirement if they possess a graduate degree from a reputable U.S. university in the field of Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or a closely related discipline, with a GPA of 3.5 or higher. In such a case, the applicant must contact the graduate program coordinator and attach a resume and transcripts for review and approval before submitting the application. International applicants who require a student visa must submit official GRE scores.
*   Resume.
*   A writing sample may be requested by the graduate admissions committee. This sample should demonstrate the applicant’s technical writing ability. Papers from previous coursework, a thesis, or work-related documents that the applicant has authored are acceptable.
*   International applicants whose primary language is not English must score a minimum of 550 (paper based) or 79 (internet based) on the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), or a minimum of 6.5 on the International English Language Testing System (IELTS).
*   All students are considered for financial aid at the time of admission. However, to guarantee consideration for a graduate assistantship, applications must be submitted by January 15.
Concentration: Computer Science, Cybersecurity Engineering, Data Science, Electrical Engineering, Robotics and Autonomous Systems, Systems Engineering
Description: The Ph.D. in Electrical Engineering & Computer Science program provides students with the skills and experience to become the next generation of leaders in academia and industry. Students will become experts in an area of their choice while broadening their knowledge of electrical engineering and computer science through a flexible, customizable curriculum. The program provides the necessary research skills to develop independent research and contribute to the body of knowledge in their specific areas of expertise. A combination of faculty mentors from both the Electrical, Computer, Software and Systems Engineering Department (ECSSE) and the College of Arts and Sciences (COAS) ensures a supportive and diverse learning environment for Ph.D. students.
ScholarshipAmount: The Dean's Doctoral Assistantship provides a $26,000 stipend per academic year plus a tuition waiver for up to 9 credit hours per semester.

ProgramName: PhD in Engineering Physics
EnglishScore: Applicants from countries where English is not the official language must demonstrate English proficiency by providing the results from any of the following: TOEFL (Test of English as a Foreign Language), IELTS (International English Language Testing System), Cambridge English Language Assessment, Duolingo, ELS Language Centers (ELS), or Pearson PTE Academic.
Requirements: Admission to the Ph.D. in Engineering Physics program is selective and competitive. Applicants are evaluated on the basis of their demonstrated scholarly aptitude and potential for success in a demanding doctoral program. Required application materials include: Completed Application, Transcripts, GRE Scores (optional for applicants with a graduate degree), Letters of Recommendation, Statement of Objectives, Resume. For International Applicants: TOEFL, IELTS, or Duolingo Scores.
Concentration: ['Space Physics', 'Atmospheric Physics', 'Remote Sensing', 'Optical & Photonic Engineering', 'Materials Physics']
Description:
Embry-Riddle’s Ph.D. in Engineering Physics program is designed for students with a passion for physics and a desire to pursue their interests through research at the highest level. Students have the opportunity to work alongside leading experts in the field, utilizing sophisticated equipment and facilities to help push the boundaries of science.

The program’s mission is to produce professionals who can conduct, lead, and manage original research in government or industry, or join the academia.

Research specializations are available in Space Physics, Atmospheric Physics, Remote Sensing, Optical & Photonic Engineering, and Materials Physics.

Our doctoral candidates are immersed in an interdisciplinary environment with close ties to the departments of aerospace, mechanical, and electrical engineering, as well as being part of ERAU's rapidly expanding research programs.

ProgramName: PhD in Human Factors
EnglishScore: For those whose primary language is not English, a minimum score on the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) of 213 (computer-based) or 79 (Internet-based) is required. The International English Language Testing System (IELTS) exam with a minimum score of 6.0 is also accepted. A score of 550 on the paper-based TOEFL is acceptable as long as it is accompanied by the Test of Written English with a score of at least 4.0.
Requirements:
Applicants for the Ph.D. in Human Factors must provide the following:

A completed application.
Transcripts from all institutions attended.
A three- to five-page typed statement of purpose that details the applicant's professional goals and how this degree will help achieve them; relevant experience, including research; and the Embry-Riddle faculty members whose work is of particular interest to the student and why.
A curriculum vitae (CV) or resume outlining the applicant's academic and work history.
Three letters of recommendation.
Scores on the general Graduate Record Exam (GRE) are required. We look for a combined Verbal and Quantitative score of 300 or greater, and an Analytical Writing score of 4.0 or greater. International students may need to submit TOEFL, IELTS or Cambridge English Exam scores.
A research paper or other writing sample (optional, but highly recommended).
Description:
The Embry-Riddle Ph.D. in Human Factors is designed for students who wish to further their knowledge of human capabilities and limitations, and to apply this knowledge to the design, operation, and maintenance of the systems and technologies that we use every day. The interdisciplinary doctoral program emphasizes both research and practice in the application of human factors principles.

The degree is housed in the Department of Human Factors and Behavioral Neurobiology in the College of Arts and Sciences on the Daytona Beach Campus.

Students who earn a Ph.D. in Human Factors will possess the knowledge and skills to make significant research contributions or to be a practitioner in high-technology settings like aviation, aerospace, healthcare, and surface transportation.

The program offers a diverse yet structured curriculum, allowing students from a variety of backgrounds to pursue their academic goals. Ph.D. students will learn about human factors and ergonomics, cognitive psychology, perception, research design, and statistics.
