They will have the opportunity to take specialized courses in areas such as human-computer interaction, automation, organizational behavior, accident investigation, and simulation.

Doctoral students are required to conduct original, empirical research as part of their dissertation. Throughout their studies at Embry-Riddle, students in the Human Factors Ph.D. program will work closely with a faculty mentor to develop and refine their research ideas.

ProgramName: PhD in Mechanical Engineering
EnglishScore: International students are required to provide TOEFL, IELTS, or Cambridge English scores. Other accepted methods to demonstrate proficiency include completing ELS Level 112, or achieving minimum scores on the Duolingo English Test or Pearson PTE Academic test.
Concentration: Aerospace Structures and Materials, Robotics and Autonomous Systems, Thermal Sciences
Description:
The Ph.D. in Mechanical Engineering program at Embry-Riddle provides an innovative curriculum that combines a strong research-based foundation with an emphasis on aerospace and aviation applications. The doctoral program prepares students to become highly-skilled researchers, university professors, and industry leaders. Students will not only possess expertise in their field of study, but will also have the tools to discover, generate, apply, and transmit new knowledge.

From designing more efficient aircraft engines to developing new sources of energy, mechanical engineers make a difference in the world by developing creative solutions. The program combines a strong research-based foundation with an emphasis on aerospace and aviation applications, while also embracing broader applications.

Coursework will cover theory and application in areas of mechanical engineering such as advanced materials, instrumentation and data acquisition, computational fluid dynamics, multiphase flow, and more. Students will also complete a required teaching practicum.

ProgramName: Certificate in Airline Management
EnglishScore: Applicants for whom English is not the primary language must demonstrate English proficiency. Minimum acceptable scores are: TOEFL 550 (paper-based) or 79 (iBT); IELTS 6.0; Cambridge English Language Assessment 170; Duolingo 105; PTE Academic 53; or successful completion of the ELS Language Centers' level 112 English for Academic Purposes (EAP) program.
Requirements: The Worldwide Campus has a rolling admissions policy. It is recommended to apply at least 60 days prior to the start of the term. To apply for an undergraduate program, you will need to submit an online application and official transcripts from all institutions attended. ERAU is test-optional, meaning you can choose whether or not to submit SAT or ACT scores as part of your application. International applicants may be required to submit additional documentation.
Description: The Certificate of Completion in Airline Management program offers business-focused courses designed to give students a comprehensive understanding of the airline industry, covering topics such as airline operations, management, marketing, finance, and economics. Students will gain the skills and knowledge necessary to succeed in various roles within the airline industry, including positions in airline management, operations, marketing, and finance. The program is ideal for individuals seeking to enter the airline industry, as well as for current airline professionals looking to advance their careers. The program culminates in a capstone course that allows students to apply their knowledge to a real-world airline management project.

ProgramName: Graduate Certificate in Airworthiness Engineering
EnglishScore: Applicants from countries where English is not the official language must demonstrate English proficiency by one of several methods, including submitting scores for TOEFL (iBT score of 80), IELTS (overall score of 6.0), Duolingo (overall score of 105), PTE Academic (overall score of 53), or completing ELS Level 112. Other methods based on prior education in English are also accepted.
Requirements: To be considered for admission to the Graduate Certificate in Airworthiness Engineering program, applicants must have a bachelor's degree in engineering or a closely related discipline with a cumulative grade point average (CGPA) of 3.0 or higher from an accredited degree-granting institution. Applicants with a CGPA less than 3.0 may be considered on a case-by-case basis. In addition, the applicant must also submit: Official transcripts from all attended institutions. Two letters of recommendation. A resumé or curriculum vitae (CV).
Description: The Graduate Certificate in Airworthiness Engineering is a 12-credit graduate-level, non-degree program for working professionals and graduate students who want to develop or expand their skills in the field of airworthiness engineering. This certificate program provides a strong foundation of knowledge in aircraft certification and continuing airworthiness for students with a bachelor's degree in engineering or a related technical discipline. The knowledge gained from this program can assist engineers and managers in developing safe, airworthy aircraft. This certificate program is offered through Embry-Riddle’s Worldwide & Online Campus.

ProgramName: Graduate Certificate in Human Factors
EnglishScore: Students from a country where English is not the primary language must submit proof of English proficiency. The following are the minimum scores required for admission to a degree program: TOEFL (Test of English as a Foreign Language): 79 on iBT (internet-based test) or 550 on PBT (paper-based test); IELTS (International English Language Testing System): 6.0 overall band score; Duolingo English Test: 105; PTE Academic (Pearson Test of English): 53; Cambridge English Scale: 170; ELS Language Centers: Completion of Level 112.
Fees: Worldwide Campus: $9,840 (total program estimate); Daytona Beach Campus: $21,744 (total program estimate)
Description: Embry-Riddle’s Graduate Certificate in Human Factors program provides students with a solid foundation in human factors principles and practices. The program is designed for working professionals who want to expand their knowledge in human factors or are looking to switch careers. Students will gain the skills to design and evaluate systems that are safe, effective and desirable for human use. The certificate program requires the completion of four courses, which may also be applied toward a Master of Science in Human Factors degree. Graduates with this certificate are prepared for careers in a variety of industries, including aviation, healthcare, automotive and consumer products.

ProgramName: Graduate Certificate in Marketing
EnglishScore: Students whose native language is not English are required to provide official scores from one of the following English language proficiency exams: TOEFL (79 iBT or 550 PBT), IELTS (6.0 overall band score), Cambridge English Language Assessment (170), Duolingo (105), Pearson PTE Academic (53), or ELS Language Centers (Completion of Level 112 with a 2.5 GPA).
Requirements: Applicants for the Graduate Certificate in Marketing must have a baccalaureate degree from an accredited degree-granting institution with a cumulative grade point average (CGPA) of 2.5 or higher on a 4.0 scale. Applicants who already possess a graduate degree from an accredited degree-granting institution need only submit the graduate application and copies of their graduate and undergraduate transcripts. International applicants are required to meet the University’s English language proficiency requirements.
Department: David B. O'Maley College of Business
Description: The Graduate Certificate in Marketing provides students with skills critical for any professional seeking to move into a leadership position. The coursework offers opportunities to develop and implement marketing strategies, while strengthening the overall understanding of organizational behavior and structure. Students gain the skills to develop, implement and control marketing activities, combined with the core values to rise to the top of an organization. This certificate will also develop critical thinking skills that are necessary to evaluate global marketing issues.
Accredidation: The David B. O'Maley College of Business at Embry-Riddle Aeronautical University is accredited by the Accreditation Council for Business Schools and Programs (ACBSP).

ProgramName: Graduate Certificate in Project Management
EnglishScore: Applicants whose primary language is not English must either: Attain a minimum score on the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) of 550 (PBT) or 79 (iBT). The Embry-Riddle TOEFL code is 5190. Or Attain a minimum overall score on the International English Language Testing System (IELTS) of 6.0. Or Show evidence of attendance and graduation from a secondary school in which the language of instruction was English. Or successfully complete a college-level English Composition course with a grade of “C” or better from a U.S. based college or university.
Requirements: Applicants for admission to the Embry-Riddle Worldwide graduate certificate programs must have a baccalaureate degree from an accredited degree-granting institution with a cumulative grade point average (CGPA) of 2.5 or higher on a 4.0 scale.
Description:
As industries like aviation, aerospace, manufacturing, technology and healthcare become more complex, the need for skilled project managers continues to rise. The Graduate Certificate in Project Management from Embry-Riddle provides students with the foundational expertise required to effectively manage projects and can be a valuable differentiator when it comes to job opportunities and career advancement.

Students learn the processes and techniques needed to improve project efficiency and organizational effectiveness. The certificate also serves as an excellent pathway to the Master of Science in Project Management (MSPM) degree. Credits completed in the certificate program may be transferred into the MSPM degree with departmental approval.
ScholarshipType: Military & Veteran Benefits, Corporate Partnerships, Federal Student Aid
